channel.title: Java Tutorials: Question
channel.description:
Em, sorry to bother you guys, but I'd just like to ask a simple question. I've been reading and revising the Java tutorials recently (http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/) and I got a little confused.
Basically, I'm wondering if I should have any programming experience at all before reading these? They keep referring to Java's syntax and how I, the reader, [i][b]may[/b][/i] not recognise it. Uh, ofcourse I don't, I'm reading tutorials for beginners! Does this mean that I should have a faint idea of basic syntaxes/know other languages (Even barely)? Are there other tutorials I should read before these?
The tutorials show Java code now and then, and explain how the code would make X happen, and I understand how the code would make it happen, but should I also be taking note of the actual code, and should I have a vague idea of how to write it already?
Cheers.

item.title: Java Tutorials: Question
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I personally think tutorials don’t do much, you won’t learn unless you start doing things for yourself, and no, you don’t need programming experience, the “may” can go both ways.

I really do think that in languages such as Java, your better off learning by trial and error.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Tutorials: Question

item.description:
